title: 2nd of the night: Font Bureau Specimen PDFs
content:
Apologies for asking for two IDs in a night, I’m just going through a major typography kick right now.

Does anybody know the typeface used in the Font Bureau specimen PDFs? I’ve attached a sample. Love that uppercase “Y” and the lowercase “a.”

Thanks,  
Josh

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [FontBureauSpecimen.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119151322/http:/typophile.com/files/FontBureauSpecimen.jpg) | 35.48 KB |

 [‹ Cruzcampo typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119151322/http:/typophile.com/node/17172 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Puerto Rico" board game typeface - Malvern {Mike F} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119151322/http:/typophile.com/node/17132 "Go to next forum topic")
author: joshcarr

comments.content: So fast once again. Thanks, Miss Tiffany!

I’m sure Miss Tiffany was able to identify Eldorado by eye. Those of us who can’t (or who have trouble doing so) can usually find what fonts are used in a PDF by calling up Document Properties and then choosing the Fonts category.
